rev.diff:
Line 127: Line 127:
* Roy's t-shirts contain various IT references and cult games. These include "[[RTFM]]", an alien from ''[[Space Invaders]]'', the 256th level of ''[[Pac-Man]]'' and the number [[Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything|42]].
* Roy's t-shirts contain various IT references and cult games. These include "[[RTFM]]", an alien from ''[[Space Invaders]]'', the 256th level of ''[[Pac-Man]]'' and the number [[Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything|42]].
* Stickers decorating the office include '[[MP3]] is not a Crime'; '[[Fair Use]] [[Andre the Giant Has a Posse|has a posse]]'; the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]; and an [[O RLY?|O rly?]] Owl, as well as a Camel sticker in reference to [[Programming Perl]].
* Stickers decorating the office include '[[MP3]] is not a Crime'; '[[Fair Use]] [[Andre the Giant Has a Posse|has a posse]]'; the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]; and an [[O RLY?|O rly?]] Owl, as well as a Camel sticker in reference to [[Programming Perl]].
â
* The [[title sequence]] animation (created by [[Shynola]]) depicts a [[Linux kernel]] [[Kernel panic|panicking]] during a [[Fedora Core|Fedora Core 4]] installation (akin to the [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[blue screen of death]]).
+
* The [[title sequence]] animation (created by [[Shynola]]) depicts a [[Linux kernel]] [[Kernel panic|panicking]] during a [[Fedora Core|Fedora Core]] 4 installation (akin to the [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[blue screen of death]]).
* The show's theme song is modelled on [[Gary Numan]]'s work, specifically his 1979 song "[[Are 'Friends' Electric?]]". <ref>{{cite news|last=Ramaswamy|first=Chitra|title=Divine intervention|publisher =[[The Scotsman]]|date=[[June 4]], [[2006]]|url =http://scotlandonsunday.scotsman.com/review.cfm?id=822292006|accessdate=[[September 10]], [[2007]]}}</ref>
* The show's theme song is modelled on [[Gary Numan]]'s work, specifically his 1979 song "[[Are 'Friends' Electric?]]". <ref>{{cite news|last=Ramaswamy|first=Chitra|title=Divine intervention|publisher =[[The Scotsman]]|date=[[June 4]], [[2006]]|url =http://scotlandonsunday.scotsman.com/review.cfm?id=822292006|accessdate=[[September 10]], [[2007]]}}</ref>
* The slideshow at the end of "Yesterday's Jam" is a stock [[iPhoto]] slideshow, including the [[Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring|default music]].
* The slideshow at the end of "Yesterday's Jam" is a stock [[iPhoto]] slideshow, including the [[Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring|default music]].
